title: cryptsetup: Fails to detect crypted devices on LVM

sentences.text: Since the upgrade from 1.3 to 1.4 my system no longer boots.
Seems to be a problem when trying to detect my root filesystem:
cryptsetup: WARNING: failed to find deps for vg--sda-root
cryptsetup: FAILURE: could not determine configuration for vg--sda-root ....
The result of the warning/failure is a missing cryptroot file in initrd.
Maybe a problem with the (strange) naming of my LVM volume group (vg-sda)?
I managed to restore this file manually by guessing the format from a working Debian/testing system and booting from a rescue CD.
What information should I provide to help fixing the problem?
BOOT_IMAGE=/vmlinuz-3.2.0-1-amd64 root=/dev/mapper/vg--sda-root ro quiet pcie_aspm=force threadirqs
Versions of packages cryptsetup depends on:
> cryptsetup: WARNING: failed to find deps for vg--sda-root
> cryptsetup: FAILURE: could not determine configuration for vg--sda-root > ....
> The result of the warning/failure is a missing cryptroot file in initrd.
> Maybe a problem with the (strange) naming of my LVM volume group (vg-sda)?
it could be - note that lvm uses dash ("-") to separate VG and LV name in kernel device-mapper, so all other dashes are doubled (that's why you see vg--sda-root).
Either the script should use /dev/VG/LV path (instead of /dev/mapper/...)
or you should decode lvm name using dmsetup:
the bug is in line 150 of /usr/share/initramfs-tools/hooks/cryptroot:
if the name contains a dash, it is mangled.
a simple solution is to replace that line with this line:
please fix this ASAP because it's really a BIG problem for people using full disk encryption.
We believe that the bug you reported is fixed in the latest version of cryptsetup, which is due to be installed in the Debian FTP archive:
A summary of the changes between this version and the previous one is attached.
Thank you for reporting the bug, which will now be closed.
If you have further comments please address them to 659235@bugs.debian.org, and the maintainer will reopen the bug report if appropriate.
Jonas Meurer <mejo@debian.org> (supplier of updated cryptsetup package)
(This message was generated automatically at their request;
if you believe that there is a problem with it please contact the archive administrators by mailing ftpmaster@debian.org)
Binary: cryptsetup libcryptsetup4 libcryptsetup-dev cryptsetup-udeb libcryptsetup4-udeb
cryptsetup - disk encryption support - commandline tools
cryptsetup-udeb - disk encryption support - commandline tools (udeb) (udeb)
libcryptsetup-dev - disk encryption support - development files  libcryptsetup4 - disk encryption support - shared library
libcryptsetup4-udeb - disk encryption support - shared library (udeb) (udeb)
* acknowledge NMU. Thanks to Michael Biebl. (closes: #659182)
* don't print error for non-encrypted rootfs in initramfs cryptroot hook.      Thanks to Jamie Heilman and Christoph Anton Mitterer for bugreports.
* use dmsetup splitname to extract VG name from $node in initramfs cryptroot      hook. Thanks to Kai Weber for the bugreport, Milan Broz and Claudio
